subject: Learning
title: The Achievement Gap
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Achievement Gap.

hook.text: By age 5, a child from a low-income family has heard 30 million fewer words than a wealthy peer.

buildup.text: The achievement gapâ€”differences in outcomes by race, income, and geographyâ€”is education's stubborn challenge.

discovery.text: It starts before school and widens each year, driven by resource inequity, not ability differences.

twist.text: Countries like Finland nearly closed the gap by equalizing school funding and teacher quality.

climax.text: The gap isn't about student potential. It's about what society invests in each student.

punchline.text: Equal talent. Unequal opportunity. That's the gap.

quiz.question: What primarily drives the achievement gap?
